title: Drawing, "Alexander the Great and Diogenes", 1820–22
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over graphite, white laid paper
inscribed: In pen and brown ink, at lower margin: Allesandro e Diogene.
dimensions:
55.2 x 77 cm (21 3/4 x 30 5/16 in.)
dimensions vary
Mat:  71.1 x 91.4 cm (28 x 36 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Landscape drawing with figures. Diogenes sitting in far right foreground in front of barrel, surrounded by books and pupils; Alexander stands at left foreground with a group of followers; Athens is shown in the background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Alexander the Great and Diogenes", 1820–22.
1820–22. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over graphite, white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3346.
